subject: Communication
title: Power Distance: Who Decides?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Power Distance: Who Decides?.

hook.text: In Denmark, a junior employee emails the CEO directly. In Malaysia, that would be career suicide.

buildup.text: Power Distance measures how much a society accepts unequal distribution of power. High PD = hierarchy is natural.

discovery.text: High PD countries (Malaysia, Philippines, Mexico) expect deference.

twist.text: Korean Air crashes in the 1990s were partly caused by high power distance â€” co-pilots wouldn't correct senior pilots'.

climax.text: Power distance shapes everything: management style, classroom dynamics, parent-child relationships, and political.

punchline.text: Some cultures ask 'who decides?' Others ask 'why should anyone decide for me?'

quiz.question: What does high power distance in a culture indicate?
